Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for Messe Berlin”
Reviews.Author: mao75
Reviews.Content: Hotel ideally located for Tegel Airport and Messe Berlin, less if you are going to Berlin to visit the city (however the underground station is litteraly few meters away from the hotel). Reception staff extremely courteous! Extra positive point (being a smoker!): they have smoking rooms available on the last floor, with a cosy balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Nicer inside than outside”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value if you have business in the neighbourhood, otherwise too far from the city centre. Much better inside than what you would expect from the exterior pictures on the hotel website. NIce and quiet rooms, good breakfast (I don't see the point in stuffing myself at 8 am).

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place to stay and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Abaji
Reviews.Content: Date: 3-10 July 2011 We booked this hotel for our week-long stay in Germany, Berlin through our corporate travel desk. This was first travel experience for us to any European country but the friendly staff at this place really made us feel at home. It is the friendly service that makes it worthwhile staying in this hotel. The reception team was always ready to help and they also guided us for local site seeings we could do with limited time we had after the business activities. The room we had was spacious and pretty, the breakfast is good (Considering Germany is tough place for veterinarians) and the distance to any place in Berlin is not a issue as the Tube station is next to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, excellent business services”
Reviews.Author: Pietro_HU
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is pretty close to Berlin Tegel Airport. You can get there for about 10€ by taxi. The hotel is right by the exit of the Siemensdam metro station, so its pretty convenient to get there by public transport. Room comfort is pretty OK, though it was slightly cold for me on the first night (the extra blanket solved the problem). The hotel is an excellent place for business trips, as the conference rooms and services meet all business requirements. They provide all the stuff to have your meeting in the hotel, including presentation tools, meeting rooms and catering.

Reviews.Title: “too much noise,”
Reviews.Author: dennis37139
Reviews.Content: the room are not well insonosize, so if you got noisy neighbor, forget about sleep :-) just "business" hotel far away from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Facility, Affordable Price, but Far from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Stephy Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is great and comfortable with standard Mercure room, ambience, facility. I booked online in Accor's website and the price was really affordable to the facility it provided. The hotel also has a swimming pool though it was freezing when I was there in winter time (but it summer it should work well). Hotel staffs and receptionists, though they don't speak English very well, but they try to help as much as possible consideing the tourists attractions information. The underground metro station is located next to the hotel, and it takes you around 20 - 30 minutes to reach the city center (Kurfurstendamm and Postdamer Platz areas, or the Berlin Hauptbahnhof). The hotel is located quite far from the city centre (though perhaps it is one of the reason why the price is affordable because apparently it is hard to get the same price with the same facility at the city centre). Nearby the hotels are supermarkets, restaurants and cafes. The only weak point is just the location, othet than that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: wensdazechyld
Reviews.Content: Staff were LOVELY. restaurant - limited menu and pricey for what you get. Limited English-speaking TV stations. Tube station right outside hotel. Room was cold but they were struggling with temps of -20c when we were staying. No tea-making facilities in room. Very basic hotel but fine if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, reasonably priced, friendly staff, convenient to public transportation”
Reviews.Author: snimples
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for those traveling in and out of Tegelhof. It's about 10 - 15 minutes away from the airport. We found the rooms to be clean, reasonably appointed and comfortable. The reception staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. We even ate one night at the hotel restaurant and were favorably impressed by the food and wine selection. We never tried breakfast at the hotel, which we were forewarned was very expensive. However, there's a nice pastry/coffee shop about a one-minute walk from the hotel. (It's part of a German national chain called "Kamps." The prices were very reasonable, and the food and coffee were terrific. While the hotel is not directly in the center of the city, it was no problem to take the U-bahn, which is located 10 seconds from the hotel's door. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location not a drawback.”
Reviews.Author: Kenny-Lyle
Reviews.Content: Would recommend the hotel to anyone who is wanting decent enough standard of accommodation without having to pay city centre prices. As with the rest of Germany , public transport is peerless and having had some trepidation about arriving at Schonefeld and having to get across to other side of Berlin, I made the journey in under 1 hour. From the hotel to Zoo is under 20 minutes with one change and it lies on the U Bahn line a few stops short of Spandau which is a seperate town completely. All in all I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: unspecified
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. I have stayed in this hotel several times and have always been happy to return. It's clean, the rooms are comfortable (don't underestimate the benefits of decent, black curtains that really stop you being woken up at sunrise - sadly lacking from most hotels). The breakfasts are good, and without exception, all the staff are wonderfully friendly and helpful. The location is well out of town, but is literally next door to a U-Bahn station, so that doesn't matter too much. Allow 20-30 mins to get into the centre, depending on where you're aiming for. I thoroughly recommend this hotel, primarily for business travel but I could also see it having some tourist potential.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Hotel Berlin City West
HotelInfo.Address: Ohmstrasse 4-6, 13629 Berlin, Germany
